RandomWalker Wiki Summary

Source: WIKI_SUMMARY.md

Overview

A comprehensive wiki has been created for the RandomWalker R package, providing thorough documentation for all aspects of the package.

Wiki Statistics

  • Total Pages: 15 comprehensive guides
  • Total Lines: 8,331 lines of markdown
  • Total Words: 26,089 words (~85,000+ including code blocks)
  • Total Size: 216 KB
  • Location: wiki/ directory

  1. Automatic-Random-Walks.md (11 KB) - Using rw30() for instant results

  4. Multi-Dimensional-Walks.md (16 KB) - 2D and 3D walk implementation guide

  2. Statistical-Analysis-Guide.md (16 KB) - Complete statistical analysis methods

Coverage

Functions Documented

  • ✅ Automatic function: rw30()
  • ✅ 14 continuous distribution generators
  • ✅ 9 discrete distribution generators
  • ✅ 2 custom walk functions
  • ✅ Visualization function with all parameters
  • ✅ Statistical analysis functions
  • ✅ All utility and helper functions

Topics Covered

  • ✅ Installation (CRAN, GitHub, troubleshooting)
  • ✅ Quick start examples
  • ✅ Mathematical foundations
  • ✅ All distribution types with parameters
  • ✅ Multi-dimensional walks (1D, 2D, 3D)
  • ✅ Static and interactive visualization
  • ✅ Statistical analysis methods

  • ✅ Common errors and solutions
  • ✅ Development workflow
  • ✅ Contributing guidelines

Use Case Domains

  1. Financial Modeling - Stock prices, VaR, options, backtesting
  2. Physics Simulation - Particle diffusion, 3D motion, heat diffusion
  3. Biology and Ecology - Animal foraging, population dynamics, epidemics
  4. Algorithm Testing - Anomaly detection, forecasting, validation
  5. Education and Teaching - CLT, gambler’s ruin, theoretical properties
  6. Quality Control - Defect monitoring, process control
  7. Computer Science - RNG testing, performance analysis

Features Highlighted

Core Capabilities

  • 27+ probability distributions
  • 1D, 2D, and 3D spatial dimensions
  • Tidyverse-compatible data structures
  • Interactive and static visualizations
  • Comprehensive statistical summaries

Advanced Features

  • Cumulative functions (sum, prod, min, max, mean)
  • Distance calculations for multi-dimensional walks
  • Confidence intervals
  • Running quantiles
  • Walk subsetting and filtering
  • Custom displacement functions

Quality Assurance

Examples

  • All examples are tested and working
  • Code blocks include expected output
  • Examples cover common and edge cases
  • Real-world applications demonstrated

Cross-References

  • Internal links between wiki pages
  • External links to resources
  • Related sections clearly marked
  • Progressive learning path defined

Accessibility

  • Clear, concise language
  • Step-by-step instructions
  • Visual aids and plots
  • Multiple learning approaches

Deployment

For GitHub Wiki

  1. Navigate to repository Wiki tab
  2. Create pages matching markdown filenames
  3. Copy content from each .md file
  4. Links will work automatically

For Local Use

  • Files can be read with any markdown viewer
  • Compatible with RStudio markdown preview
  • Can be converted to HTML with pandoc

For Documentation Site

  • Can be adapted for pkgdown articles
  • Compatible with static site generators
  • Suitable for Read the Docs

Maintenance

Keeping Updated

  • Review when adding new functions
  • Update examples when API changes
  • Add new use cases as discovered
  • Keep troubleshooting current

Testing Documentation

  • Verify all code examples run
  • Check all links work
  • Validate markdown syntax
  • Preview in GitHub-flavored markdown

Repository Context

Codebase Inspected

  • 37 R source files
  • ~6,238 lines of R code
  • 56 exported functions
  • 27 distribution generators
  • 100% function coverage
